description: Number of permutations of up to n kinds of objects, where each kind of object can occur at most two times.
comments: E.g.f. A(x)=y satisfies 0=(2x^3+2x^2)y''+(-3x^3+4x-1)y'+(x^3-x^2-2x+3)y. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 15 2004Number of ways to use the elements of {1,..,k}, 0<=k<=2n, once each to form a sequence of n (possibly empty) sets, each having at most 2 elements. - Bob Proctor, Apr 18 2005
references: J. Riordan, An Introduction to Combinatorial Analysis, Wiley, 1958, p. 17.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Robert A. Proctor, Let's Expand Rota's Twelvefold Way For Counting Partitions!, arXiv:math.CO/0606404, Jan 05, 2007
Index entries for related partition-counting sequences
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
